p: Study quality was only fair, with 45 out of the 59 studies scoring 7 or higher on the Joanna Briggs Institute tool. In addition, we were only able to meta-analyse data from 25 of the studies, although it is important to note that all but two of these were good quality studies, and all were rated silver on quality of evidence. This is the highest possible rating for a non-randomised study. 10 Results for the two continuous outcomes showed high heterogeneity, which is why we have emphasised the dichotomous results where the I 2 score was low. Finally, we were only able to test for publication bias in the two outcomes that had 10 or more studies.
